intro: Hieracium macranthelum subsp. polymnoon, commonly known as the showy hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and ray florets. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as meadows and roadsides. Its leaves are lanceolate and hairy, while its flowers are yellow with prominent central disk florets. It is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
